name: Form Controls
description: Manual accessibility checklist for form control components (buttons, inputs, checkboxes, radios, selects, etc.)

items.description: Form control has a programmatically associated label
items.procedure: Inspect the form control and verify it has a visible label element with matching 'for' attribute, or aria-label/aria-labelledby
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces the label when the control receives focus

items.procedure: Check required fields have aria-required='true' or the required attribute, and visual indicator
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces 'required' when field receives focus

items.description: Error messages are programmatically associated with inputs
items.procedure: Trigger a validation error and verify error message is linked via aria-describedby or aria-errormessage
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces error message when invalid field receives focus

items.description: Instructions and hints are provided for user input
items.procedure: Verify fields with specific format requirements have visible instructions or placeholder hints
items.expectedOutcome: Users understand the expected input format before entering data

items.description: Form control has correct role and state
items.procedure: Inspect ARIA role and states (checked, selected, disabled, expanded)
items.expectedOutcome: Role and state are accurately reflected and updated dynamically

items.description: Form control is fully keyboard operable
items.procedure: Tab to the control, operate it using only keyboard (Space, Enter, arrows as appropriate)
items.expectedOutcome: All functionality is available via keyboard without requiring mouse

items.procedure: Tab to the control and verify a visible focus indicator appears
items.expectedOutcome: Focus indicator has sufficient contrast (3:1) and is clearly visible

items.description: Focus and hover states have sufficient contrast
items.procedure: Check focus/hover border or outline has 3:1 contrast against adjacent colors
items.expectedOutcome: Focus and hover states meet non-text contrast requirements

items.procedure: Compare the visible label text with the accessible name (aria-label or computed name)
items.expectedOutcome: Accessible name includes the visible label text

items.description: Information is not conveyed by color alone
items.procedure: Verify error/success/warning states use icons or text in addition to color
items.expectedOutcome: State changes are perceivable without relying on color perception
